content:
Diagnosis:		Squamous cell carcinoma of scalp

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Wide local excision with skin graft
			25 Jan 2024 Right neck dissection - 2/15 nodes positive
			Commenced adjuvant radiotherapy 1 Mar 2024

Histology:		Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma
			PD-L1 expression <1%
			2/15 lymph nodes positive, no extracapsular spread

Current situation:	Week 4 of adjuvant radiotherapy

[redacted name] attended for review during radiotherapy treatment today. He is managing the treatment relatively well with grade 1 radiation dermatitis affecting the right scalp and neck treatment fields. He reports some mild fatigue but is maintaining normal daily activities. His appetite remains good with stable weight. The surgical sites are well healed with no evidence of recurrence. The skin graft shows good take with no complications. Performance status remains 0.

On examination, there is expected radiation-related erythema of the scalp and right neck. No palpable cervical lymphadenopathy. The treated area shows no evidence of recurrence.

The plan is to complete the prescribed course of radiotherapy (60Gy in 30 fractions). We will review again in clinic in 2 weeks' time at treatment completion.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision with skin graft
Right neck dissection - 2/15 nodes positive, no extracapsular spread

patient_facts.value: Grade 1 radiation dermatitis affecting right scalp and neck treatment fields
Expected radiation-related erythema of scalp and right neck, no palpable cervical lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Scalp SCC with nodal involvement, post-surgery, currently receiving adjuvant radiotherapy with good tolerance
Grade 1 radiation dermatitis and mild fatigue
Review in clinic in 2 weeks at treatment completion
